item.title: How to use service accounts for Kubernetes imagePullSecrets
item.description: What are Service Accounts in Kubernetes? As per Kubernetes.io - A service account provides an identity for processes that run in a Pod. One can think of service accounts as service users for pods. They help pods authenticate with the api-server and interact with it. Many times, we come across a situation where our organization uses a private Docker registry to store the Docker images and to make this available we need to create a docker-registry kubernetes secret and pass as imagePullSecrets in the deployment manifest.
